title: Carn Ingli Walk Route

images.title: On Carn Ingli by Bill Boaden, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: On Carn Ingli (Angel Mountain)

images.title: Dylan Moore / Carningli Tramway
images.caption: Carningli Tramway. This tramway, abandoned for 75 years, conveyed stone to the valley. A few iron sleepers are still visible.

images.title: Lower outcrop on Carningli by Dylan Moore, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Lower outcrop on Carningli

images.title: ceridwen / Carningli fort from Carningli common looking east
images.caption: Carningli fort from Carningli common looking east. This is the fortified summit of Mynydd Carningli viewed from the plateau known as Carningli Common, due west. The path, used by both sheep and people, leads towards Mynydd Caregog and Bedd Morys.

images.title: Possible hut circles on Carningli Common by Bill Boaden, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Possible hut circles on Carningli Common

images.title: Cairn on Newport Common by Dylan Moore, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Cairn on Newport Common

images.title: Carn Ingli by Ian Medcalf, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Stone wall and amazing view

images.title: Top of Carningli, Newport by Dylan Moore, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The striking rocky top of Carningli

description: This walk climbs to Carn Ingli mountain in the Preseli Hills of Pembrokeshire. The area is designated as a Site of Special Scientific Interest due to its rare flora and fauna. There's also a number of fascinating ancient sites, wonderful geology and some stunning views to the Pembrokeshire coast. You can start the walk from the public car park just south of the village of Newport. From here you can pick up the old railway trails heading west to the hill summit. Here you will find the Iron Age Carningli Hillfort, one of the largest hillforts in west Wales. The expansive site includes a series of substantial stone embankments, natural rock cliffs and scree slopes. There's also terraced enclosures, hut circles and rectangles with some areas dating from the Bronze Age. From the 346 m (1,135 ft) summit there are wonderful views to the coast and the surrounding hills. To explore the area further head south east to pick up the Preseli Hills Golden Road .

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Just to the north east there's more ancient history at the photogenic Pentre Ifan. Here you will find the most well preserved neolithic dolmen in Wales and more great views.

display_address: Quarry Incline, Newport, Pembrokeshire, Cymru / Wales, SA42 0QL, United Kingdom
